memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, bool includeLineEndingCharacters=false)
memberdef.name: GetLineLength

briefdescription.para: Returns the Length of a line however it does not include the line ending characters by default. To include line ending characters the parameter includeLineEndingCharacters must be true.

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int startingLineIndex, int count)
memberdef.name: GetLineRichCharacterRange

briefdescription.para: Line endings are included in the individual lines which get returned.

parameterdescription.para: The starting index of the lines to return
A count of 0 returns 0 rows. A count of 1 returns lines[startingLineIndex] only. A count of 2 returns lines[startingLineIndex] and lines[startingLineIndex + 1].

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, int columnIndex)
memberdef.name: GetTabCountOnSameLineBeforeCursor

briefdescription.para: Implementations of this method are expected to have caching.

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, int columnIndex)
memberdef.name: GetPositionIndex

briefdescription.para: To receive a string value, one can use GetString instead.

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int positionIndex, int count)
memberdef.name: GetString

briefdescription.para: To receive a char value, one can use GetCharacter instead.

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, int count)
memberdef.name: GetLineTextRange

briefdescription.para:
Given a TextEditorModel with a preference for the right side of the cursor, the following conditional branch will play out:
-IF the cursor is amongst a word, that word will be returned.
-ELSE IF the start of a word is to the right of the cursor that word will be returned.
-ELSE IF the end of a word is to the left of the cursor that word will be returned.
'lineIndex' equal to '0' returns the first line.

detaileddescription.para: An index for ITextEditorModel.LineEndList maps 1 to 1 with this method. (i.e.) the 0th line-end index will end up returning the 0th line.
Given a 'lineIndex', return the LineEnd at ITextEditorModel.LineEndList[lineIndex - 1], and ITextEditorModel.LineEndList[lineIndex] in the form of the type LineInformation.
When 'lineIndex' == 0, then a "made-up" line ending named LineEnd.StartOfFile will be used in place of indexing at 'ITextEditorModel.LineEndList[-1]'

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, int columnIndex, bool moveBackwards)
memberdef.name: GetColumnIndexOfCharacterWithDifferingKind

briefdescription.para: moveBackwards is to mean earlier in the document (lower column index or lower row index depending on position)

simplesect.para: Will return -1 if no valid result was found.

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, int columnIndex, bool isRecursiveCall=false)
memberdef.name: ReadPreviousWordOrDefault

briefdescription.para: This method and ReadNextWordOrDefault(ITextEditorModel, int, int) are separate because of 'Ctrl + Space' bring up autocomplete when at a period.

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, int lineIndex, int columnIndex)
memberdef.name: ReadNextWordOrDefault

briefdescription.para: This method and ReadPreviousWordOrDefault(ITextEditorModel, int, int, bool) are separate because of 'Ctrl + Space' bring up autocomplete when at a period.

This method returns the text to the left of the cursor in most cases. The method name is as such because of right to left written texts.
One uses this method most often to measure the position of the cursor when rendering the UI for a font-family which is proportional (i.e. not monospace).

memberdef.argsstring: (this ITextEditorModel model, LineInformation line, int columnIndex)
memberdef.name: AssertColumnIndex
